skill.name: test-driven-development
skill.description: Use when implementing any feature or bugfix, before writing implementation code
skill.summary: Use when implementing any feature or bugfix, before writing implementation code
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation with TDD guidelines and code examples. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or external command execution capabilities. Pure prompt-based documentation safe for publication.

content.value_statement: Code written without tests first lacks verification and catches bugs too late. This skill guides you through the Red-Green-Refactor TDD cycle to write failing tests before implementation, ensuring every feature has automated verification from the start.
actual_capabilities: Guide Red-Green-Refactor TDD cycle step by step
Enforce writing failing tests before implementation
Provide good vs bad test examples in TypeScript
Identify testing anti-patterns and how to fix them
Verify tests fail for correct reasons before coding
Help debug issues through test-first approach
limitations: Does not execute tests or verify code
Does not integrate with test runners directly
Relies on human partner for test execution

use_cases.title: Learn TDD fundamentals
use_cases.description: Follow the Red-Green-Refactor cycle to build test-first habits from the start of your coding journey.

use_cases.title: Add tests to new features
use_cases.description: Ensure every feature or bugfix includes passing tests written before implementation code.

use_cases.title: Verify test-first compliance
use_cases.description: Check that all code changes have corresponding tests that failed before the implementation was written.

prompt_templates.title: Start new feature with TDD
prompt_templates.prompt: Use TDD to implement [feature description]. First write a failing test that describes the expected behavior. Show me the test failing before writing any implementation code.

prompt_templates.title: Fix bug with TDD
prompt_templates.prompt: Fix this bug using TDD: [bug description]. Start by writing a failing test that reproduces the bug behavior. Then implement the fix to make the test pass.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor safely
prompt_templates.prompt: Refactor this code using TDD principles. First ensure existing behavior is covered by tests. Then clean up while keeping all tests green.

prompt_templates.title: Review TDD compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my implementation for TDD compliance. Check if tests were written before code, if they failed for the right reasons, and if implementation is minimal to pass the tests.

output_examples.input: Use TDD to add user authentication to the login function
output: test('rejects empty email with error message', async () => {
const result = await login({ email: '', password: 'password123' });
GREEN: Minimal implementation to pass test
Next test: Add password validation, then continue the cycle.

best_practices: Always verify tests fail before writing implementation - passing immediately proves nothing
Write one behavior per test with clear names describing expected behavior
Keep implementation minimal to pass tests - resist adding features during green phase
anti_patterns: Writing implementation code before tests - delete it and start over
Testing mock behavior instead of real component behavior
Adding test-only methods to production classes instead of test utilities

faq.question: Is TDD compatible with all programming languages?
faq.answer: Yes. TDD principles apply to any language with a testing framework. The skill provides language-agnostic guidance.

faq.question: What are the limits of TDD for this skill?
faq.answer: TDD works best for testable code. Very simple configs, prototypes, and generated code may not need full TDD.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing test suites?
faq.answer: The skill guides you to add new tests without breaking existing ones. All tests must stay green after refactoring.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides guidelines. No code execution, file access, or data collection occurs.

faq.question: What if tests fail unexpectedly?
faq.answer: Check that you wrote the test correctly. Unexpected failures may indicate the test is wrong, not the implementation.

faq.question: How does TDD compare to testing after?
faq.answer: TDD proves tests work by watching them fail first. Tests written after pass immediately and prove nothing about catching bugs.
